lines.gurmukhi: 1 mIxw mUMh kwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ mMiJ invwsu hY bgulw ApqIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Manjhi Nivaasu Hai Bagulaa Apateenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crane though living at a pilgrimage centre remains without faith.

lines.gurmukhi: lvY bbIhw vrsdY jl jwie n pIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Lavai Babeehaa Varasadai Jal Jaai N Peenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The rain-bird goes on crying during rain but dries not know how to drink water.

lines.gurmukhi: vwNs sugMiD n hoveI prml sMig lIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaansu Sougandhi N Hovaee Paramal Sangi Leenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bamboo may be engrossed in sandalwood but cannot take its fragrance.

lines.gurmukhi: GuGU suJu n suJeI krmw dw hIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Karamaa Daa Heenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: So unfortunate is owl that it never beholds sun.

lines.gurmukhi: nwiB kQUrI imrg dy vqY EfIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Naabhi Kadooree Mirag Day Vatai Aodeenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though musk remains in the el of deer, yet it goes on running around in search of it.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur scw pwiqswhu muhu kwlY mIxw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sachaa Paatasiaahu Muhu Kaalai Meenaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is true emperor and the faces of the dissemblers are blackened.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 mIxy dw rwj JUTw

Shabad OS B.translation: Pretentious of dissembler are exposed

lines.gurmukhi: nIlwrI dy mt ivic pY igdVu rqw
lines.transliteration_english: Neelaaree Day Mat Vichi Pai Gidarhu Rataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Once a jackal fell into a dyer's vat and got dyed.

lines.gurmukhi: jMgl AMdir jwie kY pwKMfu kmqw
lines.transliteration_english: Jangal Andari Jaai Kai Paakhandu Kamataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Taking advantage of its changed colour, it went into the jungle and started dissembling (the animals there).

lines.gurmukhi: dir syvY imrgwvlI hoie bhY Avqw
lines.transliteration_english: Dari Sayvai Miragaavalee Hoi Bahai Avataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sitting arrogantly in its lair, it would frighten the deer into serving it.

lines.gurmukhi: krY hkUmiq AglI kUVY mid mqw
lines.transliteration_english: Karai Hakoomati Agalee Koorhai Madi Mataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Intoxicated by false pride it started ruling (over the animals) with great pomp.

lines.gurmukhi: bolix pwj auGwiVAw ijau mUlI pqw
lines.transliteration_english: Bolani Paaj Oughaarhiaa Jiu Moolee Pataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As eructation indicates the eating of radish leaf, it also got exposed when it (having listened to the howls of other jackals) also started howling.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau drgih mIxw mwrIAY kir kUVu kupqw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Daragahi Meenaa Maareeai Kari Koorhu Koupataa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus, the dissembler out of his own hypocrisis is beaten hollow in the court of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 mIxw-s`cI sMgq nhIN bxw skdw

Shabad OS B.translation: A dissembler cannot create a holy congregation-

lines.gurmukhi: coru krY inq corIAwN EVik duK BwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Choru Karai Nit Choreeaan Aorhaki Doukh Bhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: A thief commits thefts daily but ultimnately has to suffer heavily.

lines.gurmukhi: nku kMnu PiV vFIAY rwvY prnwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Naku Kannu Dharhi Vaddheeai Raavai Par Naaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ears and nose are chopped of the man who ravishes an other's wife.

lines.gurmukhi: AauGt ruDy imrg ijau ivqu hwir jUAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoughat Rudhay Mirag Jiu Vitu Haari Jooaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The position of the losing gambler is similar to the deer caught in a trap.

lines.gurmukhi: lM|I kuhil n AwveI pr vyil ipAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Lee Kuhali N Aavaee Par Vayli Piaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: A lame woman may not move properly, but being other's wife she looks lovable.

lines.gurmukhi: vg n hovin kuqIAw mIxy murdwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Vag N Hovani Kouteeaa Meenay Muradaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bitches not being there in droves the dissemblers eat the carrion.

lines.gurmukhi: pwphu mUil n qgIAY hoie AMiq KuAwrI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Paapahu Mooli N Tageeai Hoi Anti Khuaaree ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through evil actions liberation can never be attained and ultimately one becomes wretched.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 mIxw-jmpur jwvygw

Shabad OS B.translation: Dissembler will ultimately go to the hell-

lines.gurmukhi: cwnix cMd n pujeI cmkY twnwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaanani Chand N Pujaee Chamakai Taanaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glow-worm may glow as much as it likes but its shine cannot reach the brightness of moon.

lines.gurmukhi: swier bUMd brwbrI ikau AwiK vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Saair Boond Baraabaree Kiu Aakhi Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: How it could be said that the ocean and a drop of water are equal.

lines.gurmukhi: kIVI ieB n ApVY kUVw iqsu mwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Keerhee Ibh N Aparhai Koorhaa Tisu Maanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: An ant can never equal an elephant; its pride is false.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnyhwlu vKwxdw mw pwis ieAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Naanayhaalu Vakhaanadaa Maa Paasi Iaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A child's describing his maternal grand father's house to his mother is futile.

lines.gurmukhi: ijin qUM swij invwijAw dy ipMfu prwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Jini Toon Saaji Nivaajiaa Day Pind Puraanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: 0 dissembler ! if you have totallly forgotten that Lord who has bestowed body

lines.gurmukhi: muFhu GuQhu mIixAw quDu jmpuir jwxw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Muddhahu Ghudahu Meeniaa Tudhu Jam Puri Jaanaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: And soul upon you, you will go straight to the abode of Yama

lines.gurmukhi: 5 mIxy dI sMgq KotI qy duKdweI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Association with the dissembler is bad as well as painful

lines.gurmukhi: kYhw idsY aujlw msu AMdir icqY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaihaa Disai Ujalaa Masu Andari Chitai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bronze appears bright but inside it remains blackness .

lines.gurmukhi: hirAw iqlu bUAwV ijau Plu kMmu n ikqY
lines.transliteration_english: Hariaa Tilu Booaarh Jiu Phalu Kanm N Kitai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Baal: weed plant in a field of sesame may be lush green but it. fruit is worthless.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhI klI knyr dI min qin duhu iBqY
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhee Kalee Kanayr Dee Mani Tani Duhu Bhitai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The oleander bud has two aspects; externally it is beautiful but internally it is poisonous.

lines.gurmukhi: pyNJU idsin rMguly mrIAY AgilqY
lines.transliteration_english: Payndoo Disani Rangulay Mareeai Agalitai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pelijha, the ripe fruit of wild caper looks colourful but over eating it man dies instantly.

lines.gurmukhi: KrI suAwilE vysuAw jIA bJw ieqY
lines.transliteration_english: Kharee Suaaliao Vaysuaa Jeea Bajhaa Itai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Prostitute looks very beautiful but she ensnares the mind (and ultimately man stands finished).

lines.gurmukhi: KotI sMgiq mIixAw duK dyNdI imqY ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Khotee Sangati Meeniaa Doukh Dayndee Mitai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, dissembler's company causes suffering for their friends

lines.gurmukhi: 6 mIxw- nkt pMQ nrk iljwNdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of dissembler leads to hell-

lines.gurmukhi: biDku nwdu suxwiekY ijau imrgu ivxwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Badhiku Naadu Sounaai Kai Jiu Miragu Vinaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a hunter inveigles the deer with music and entraps it;

lines.gurmukhi: JIvru kuMfI mwsu lwie ijau mCI PwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Jheevaru Koundee Maasu Laai Jiu Machhee Dhaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the fisherman putting meat on hook catches hold of the fish;

lines.gurmukhi: kvlu idKwlY muhu iKVwie BvrY vyswhY
lines.transliteration_english: Kavalu Dikhaalai Muhu Khirhaai Bhavarai Vaysaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the lotus showing its blossommed face beguiles the black-bee;

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk joiq pqMg no durjn ijau dwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Joti Patang No Durajan Jiu Daahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the flame of lamp burns moth like an enemy;

lines.gurmukhi: kwlbUq hoie hsqnI mYglu EmwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Kalaa Roop Hoi Hasatanee Maigalu Aomaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the paper-model of a female elephant makes the male counterpart erotomaniac;

lines.gurmukhi: iqau nkt pMQu hY mIixAw imil nrik inbwhY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Nakat Pandu Hai Meeniaa Mili Naraki Nibaahai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the way of brazen-faced dissemblers leads towards hell.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 mIxw- sMgq inrws krdI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Dissembler's association disappoints-

lines.gurmukhi: hir cMdaurI dyiK kY krdy Brvwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Hari Chandauree Daykhi Kai Karaday Bharavaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can mirage in desert quench the thirst?

lines.gurmukhi: Ql ivic qpn BTIAw ikau lhY ipAwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Dal Vich Tapani Bhatdeeaa Kiu Lahai Piaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: People, in dreams enjoy by becoming kings (but in the morning they possess nothing).

lines.gurmukhi: suhxy rwju kmweIAY kir Bog iblwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Suhanay Raaju Kamaaeeai Kari Bhog Bilaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can one hope that the shade of a tree would remain stationary?

lines.gurmukhi: CwieAw ibrKu n rhY iQru pujY ikau Awsw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaaiaa Birakhu N Rahai Diru Pujai Kiu Aasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All this is a fake show like that of an acrobat's.

lines.gurmukhi: bwjIgr dI Kyf ijau sBu kUVu qmwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Baajeegar Dee Khayd Jiu Sabhu Koorhu Tamaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One who keeps association with dissemblers,

lines.gurmukhi: rlY ju sMgiq mIixAw auiT clY inrwsw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Ralai Ju Sangati Meeniaa Outdi Chalai Niraasaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ultimately goes (from this world) disapponited.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 mIxy pIr iPtky hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Dissemblers are accurst by the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: koiel kwNau rlweIAin ikau hovin iekY
lines.transliteration_english: Koil Kaanu Ralaaeeani Kiu Hovani Ikai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crows and cuckoos however mixed, cannot be one.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau inMdk jg jwxIAin boil bolix iPkY
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Nidak Jag Jaaneeani Boli Bolani Dhikai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise the slanderers are distinguished in the world by their cheap and low talk.

lines.gurmukhi: bguly hMsu brwbrI ikau imkin imkY
lines.transliteration_english: Bagulay Hansu Baraabaree Kiu Mikani Mikai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can a crane and a swan be equated by the same measurement?

lines.gurmukhi: iqau bymuK cuix kFIAin muih kwly itkY
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Baymoukh Chouni Kaddheeani Muhi Kaalay Tikai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the apostates are picked up, separated and stigmatized.

lines.gurmukhi: ikAw nIswxI mIixAw Kotu swlI iskY
lines.transliteration_english: Kiaa Neesaanee Meeniaa Khotu Saalee Sikai.

Shabad OS B.translation: What is the hall mark of dissemblers? They are like counter-feit coins of a fake mint.

lines.gurmukhi: isir isir pwhxI mwrIAin Eie pIr iPitkY ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Siri Siri Paahanee Maareeani Aoi Peer Dhitikai ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Shoe beating is given on their heads and they are cursed by the preceptor.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 gurU hIn ho gurU sdwauxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Being without Guru but getting called the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: rwqI nINgr Kyldy sB hoie iekTy
lines.transliteration_english: Raatee Neengar Khayladay Sabh Hoi Ikatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Children play getting together in the evening.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjw prjw hovdy kir swNg aupTy
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaa Parajaa Hovaday Kari Saang Oupatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone disguised as King and the rest as subjects, they enact ridiculous scenes.

lines.gurmukhi: ieik lskr lY Dwvdy ieik iPrdy nTy
lines.transliteration_english: Iki Lasakar Lai Dhaavaday Iki Dhiraday Natday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some of them leading the army rush from place to place and some getting defeated flee helter-skelter.

lines.gurmukhi: TIkrIAwN hwly Brin auie Kry AsTy
lines.transliteration_english: Tdeekareeaan Haalay Bharani Ui Kharay Asatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They pay tax by offering potshreds and thus become wise.

lines.gurmukhi: iKn ivic Kyf aujwiVdy Gru Gru nUM qRTy
lines.transliteration_english: Khin Vichi Khayd Ujaarhiday Gharu Gharu Noon Tratday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Within few moments they ruin their game and run for their homes.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu guxu gurU sdwiedy Eie Koty mTy ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gounu Guroo Sadaaiday Aoi Khotay Matday ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who without merit call themselves Guru, are sluggish dissemblers.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 gurU hIxy dy cyly inrws jwNdy hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Disciples of the persons without Guru get disappointed

lines.gurmukhi: aucw lMmw JMtulw ivic bwg idsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Ouchaa Lamaa Jhaatulaa Vichi Baag Disandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tall, high and luxuriant, the silk cotton tree is seen in the garden.

lines.gurmukhi: motw muFu pqwil jiV bhu grb krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Motaa Muddhu Pataali Jarhi Bahu Garab Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is proud of its stout trunk and deep roots.

lines.gurmukhi: pq supqr sohxy ivsQwru bxMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Pat Soupatar Sohanay Visadaaru Banandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its beautiful green leaves enhance its spread.

lines.gurmukhi: Pul rqy Pl bkbky hoie APl PlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Phul Ratay Phal Bakabakay Hoi Aphal Phaladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But because of its red flowers and insipid fruit it fructifies in vain.

lines.gurmukhi: swvw qoqw cuhcuhw iqsu dyiK BulMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Saavaa Totaa Chuhachuhaa Tisu Daykhi Bhuladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing it, the chirping green parrot gets deluded

lines.gurmukhi: ipCo dy pCuqwiedw Ehu Plu n lhMdw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Pichho Day Pachhoutaaidaa Aohu Phalu N Lahandaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: But repents afterwards because it gets no fruit on that tree.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gurU hIx hIjVw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Impotent are they who have no Guru

lines.gurmukhi: pihny pMjy kpVy purswvwN vysu
lines.transliteration_english: Pahilai Panjay Kaparhay Purasaavaan Vaysu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wearing five garments one may assume the garb of a male person.

lines.gurmukhi: muCw dwVHI sohxI bhu durbl vysu
lines.transliteration_english: Mouchhaan Daarhhee Sohanee Bahu Durabal Vaysu.

Shabad OS B.translation: He may have beautiful beard and moustaches and a slim body.

lines.gurmukhi: sY hiQAwrI sUrmw pMcIN prvysu
lines.transliteration_english: Sai Hadiaaree Sooramaa Pancheen Paravaysu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wielder of a hundred weapons he may be counted among prominent knights.

lines.gurmukhi: mwhru dV dIbwx ivic jwxY sBu dysu
lines.transliteration_english: Maaharu Darh Deebaan Vichi Jaanai Sabhu Daysu.

Shabad OS B.translation: He may be an adept courtier and widely known throughout the country.

lines.gurmukhi: purKu n gix purKqu ivxu kwmix ik krysu
lines.transliteration_english: Purakhu N Gani Purakhatu Vinu Kaamani Ki Karaysu.

Shabad OS B.translation: But without masculinity, of what use is he to a woman?

lines.gurmukhi: ivx gux gurU sdwiedy kaux krY Adysu ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Guroo Sadaaiday Kaoun Karai Adaysu ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Who would bow before those who are without merit and get themselves called Guru

lines.gurmukhi: 12 Shu syvw kr imldw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Beloved is attained through service

lines.gurmukhi: glI jy shu pweIAY qoqw ikau PwsY
lines.transliteration_english: Galeen Jay Sahu Paaeeai Totaa Kiu Dhaasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If mere chatter could help meet the beloved, why should a parrot remain encaged?

lines.gurmukhi: imlY nw bhuq isAwxpY kwau gUMhu igrwsY
lines.transliteration_english: Milai N Bahoutu Siaanapai Kaau Goonhu Giraasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is not attained by over-cleverness and the clever crow ultimately eats faeces.

lines.gurmukhi: jorwvrI nw ijpeI sIh shw ivxwsY
lines.transliteration_english: Joraavaree N Jipaee Seeh Sahaa Vinaasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The power also does not win (the intellect wins) because an hare caused a lion killed (by showing its reflection and making it jump into the well).

lines.gurmukhi: gIq kivqu n iBjeI Bt ByK audwsY
lines.transliteration_english: Geet Kavitu N Bhijaee Bhat Bhaykh Udaasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The beloved is not lured by lyrics and poems, otherwise why should minstrels adopt the garb of sannyasis.

lines.gurmukhi: jobn rUpu nw mohIAY rMgu kusuMB durwsY
lines.transliteration_english: Joban Roopu N Moheeai Rangu Kousounbh Duraasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is not attracted by youth and beauty because the colour of safflower is not permanent.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu syvw dohwgxI ipru imlY n hwsY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Sayvaa Dohaaganee Piru Milai N Haasai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without service (to the Lord and His creation) this soul is deserted woman and the beloved is not attained merely by laughing (foolishly). He is attained through service.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 mukqI dy Awpxy swDn inSPl

Shabad OS B.translation: All the means for liberation are useless

lines.gurmukhi: isr qlvwieAwN pweIAY cmigdV jUhy
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Talavaaay Paaeeai Chamagidarh Joohai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If bowing only could grant liberation then the bats in the forests hang from trees upside down.

lines.gurmukhi: mVI mswxI jy imlY ivc KufwN cUhy
lines.transliteration_english: Marhee Masaanee Jay Milai Vichi Khudaan Choohai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If liberation were achieved in the loneliness of crematories then rats should get it in their holes.

lines.gurmukhi: imly n vfI Awrjw ibsIAru ivhu lUhy
lines.transliteration_english: Milai N Vadee Aarajaa Biseearu Vihu Loohai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Longevity also does not bring it because snake during its whole long life goes on smouldering in its own poison.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie kucIlu vrqIAY Kr sUr BsUhy
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Koucheelu Varateeai Khar Soor Bhasoohay.

Shabad OS B.translation: If dirt could make it attainable, asses and swines always remain dirty and muddy.

lines.gurmukhi: kMd mUl icqu lweIAY AeIAV vxu DUhy
lines.transliteration_english: Kand Mool Laaeeai Aeearh Vanu Dhoohay.

Shabad OS B.translation: If relishing over tubers and roots could provide it (liberation), then herd of animals go on hauling and eating them (they should also have attained liberation).

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq nw hoveI ijau Gru ivxu bUhy ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Jioun Gharu Vinu Boohay ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a house (in fact) is useless without door, one cannot attain liberation without Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 qpwN hyTwN ByKwN nwl mukiq nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: No liberation through auterities, guises and asceticism

lines.gurmukhi: imlY ij qIriQ nwiqAwN ffwN jl vwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Milai Ji Teeradi Naatiaan Dadaan Jal Vaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one could attain liberation by taking bath at pilgrimage centres then (we know that) the frogs always live in water.

lines.gurmukhi: vwl vDwieAwN pweIAY bV jtwN plwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaal Vadhaaiaan Paaeeai Barh Jataan Palaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If growing long hair could make it available then the banyan has long roots hanging from it.

lines.gurmukhi: nMgy rihAwN jy imlY vix imrg audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Nagay Rahiaan Jay Milai Vani Mirag Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If going naked gets it, all the deer in the forest can be called detached ones.

lines.gurmukhi: Bsm lwie jy pweIAY Kru Kyh invwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhasam Laai Jay Paaeeai Kharu Khayh Nivaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If it is attained by smearing ashes on body, the ass always rolls in dust.

lines.gurmukhi: jy pweIAY cup kIiqAwN psUAwN jV hwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Paaeeai Choup Keetiaan Pasooaan Jarh Haasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If muteness could bring it, the animals and inert objects are certainly speechless.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI gur imlY KlwsI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovanee Gur Milai Khalaasee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: No liberation is attained without Guru and bondages are shattered only after meeting the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 mukqI dy Awpxy swDn inSPl

Shabad OS B.translation: One's own means are of no avail for liberation

lines.gurmukhi: jVIN bUtIN jy jIvIAY ikau mrY DnMqru
lines.transliteration_english: Jarhee Bootee Jay Jeeveeai Kiu Marai Dhanataru.

Shabad OS B.translation: If herbal medicines could keep one alive, why did Dhanvantri (the father of Indian system of medicine) die?

lines.gurmukhi: qMqu mMqu bwjIgrwN Eie Bvih idsMqru
lines.transliteration_english: Tantu Mantu Baajeegaraan Aoi Bhavahi Disantaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conjurers know many tantras and mantras yet they roam about hither and thither in the country.

lines.gurmukhi: ruKIN ibrKIN pweIAY kwst bYsMqru
lines.transliteration_english: Roukheen Birakheen Paaeeai Kaasat Baisantaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: If worship of trees could make it available, why should trees themselves get burnt (by their own fire)?

lines.gurmukhi: imlY n vIrwrwDu kir Tg cor n AMqru
lines.transliteration_english: Milai N Veeraaraadhu Kari Tdag Chor N Antaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adoration of evil and ferocious spirits also does not bring liberation because there is no basic difference between a thief and a cheat.

lines.gurmukhi: imlY n rwqI jwigAwN AprwD BvMqru
lines.transliteration_english: Milai N Raatee Jaagiaan Aparaadh Bhavantaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: Liberation cannot be attained through sleepless nights because criminals too remain awake at night wandering here and there.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI gurmuiK AmrMqru ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Guramoukhi Amarantaru ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without Guru no liberation is achieved and the Guru-oriented, gutmulchs become immortal and make others so too.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 nwlwiekwN qoN mukqI AsMBv

Shabad OS B.translation: Liberation impossible without Guru

lines.gurmukhi: GMtu GVwieAw cUihAwN gil iblI pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghantu Gharhaaiaa Choohiaan Gali Bilee Paaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rats got a bell made so that it could be hung from the neck of the cat (but it could not materialise).

lines.gurmukhi: mqw mqwieAw mKIAwN iGA AMdir nweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Mataa Mataaiaa Makheeaan Ghia Andari Naaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The flies thought of taking bath in ghee (but all got killed).

lines.gurmukhi: sUqku lhY n kIiVAwN ikau JQu lMGweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sootaku Lahai N Keerhiaan Kiu Jhadu Laghaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The defilement of worms and moth never ends then how should they spend their time!

lines.gurmukhi: swvix rihx BMbIrIAwN jy pwir vsweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Saavani Rahan Bhanbeereeaan Jay Paari Vasaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Insects keep hovering over water surfaces in Silvan (rainy month) howsoever one might try to drive them away.

lines.gurmukhi: kUMjVIAwN vYswK ivic ijau jUh prweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Koonjarheeaan Vaisaakh Vichi Jiu Jooh Paraaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As in the month of Vaisakh migratory heron birds fly over foreign lands.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur mukiq n hoveI iPir AweIAY jweIAY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Moukati N Hovaee Dhiri Aaeeai Jaaeeai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Man without the Guru is not liberated and suffers transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 kUV dw pwj kUV

Shabad OS B.translation: The lie is hollow

lines.gurmukhi: jy KuQI ibMfw bhY ikau hoie bjwj
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Khudee Bindaa Bahai Kiu Hoi Bajaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: A cricket sitting on the heap of cloth does not become a draper.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqy dy gil vwsxI n srwPI swju
lines.transliteration_english: Koutay Gal Vaasanee N Saraadhee Saaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a money belt is tied around the neck of a dog, it does not become a gold merchant.

lines.gurmukhi: rqnmxI gil bwNdrY jauhrI nih kwju
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanamanee Gali Baandarai Jauharee Nahi Kaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tying of rubies and jewels around the neck of monkey does not make it behave like a jeweller.

lines.gurmukhi: gdhuN cMdn ldIAY nihN gwNDI gwju
lines.transliteration_english: Gadahoun Chandan Ladeeai Nahin Gaandhee Gaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: Laden with sandalwood, the donkey cannot be called a perfumer.

lines.gurmukhi: jy mKI muih mkVI ikau hovY bwju
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Moukhee Muhi Makarhee Kiu Hovai Baaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: If per chance a fly goes into the mouth of a spider, the latter does not become a hawk.

lines.gurmukhi: scu scwvwN kwNFIAY kUiV kUVw pwju ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Sachaavaan Kaanddheeai Koorhi Koorhaa Paaju ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The truth is always true and the falsehood always fake

lines.gurmukhi: 18 AxhoNdw Awp gxwvy so mUrK

Shabad OS B.translation: Fool is he who though devoid of virtues counts his merits

lines.gurmukhi: 19 AxhoNdw Awp gxwaU gvwr hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Fool is he who though devoid of virtues counts his merits

lines.gurmukhi: AM|ix puqu gvwNFxI kUVwvw mwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Anni Poutu Gavaanddhanee Koorhaavaa Maanu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pride on account of a neighbour's son who has come to your courtyard is false and vain.

lines.gurmukhi: pwlI cauxw cwrdw Gr ivqu n jwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Paalee Chaounaa Chaaradaa Ghar Vitu N Jaanu.

Shabad OS B.translation: A cowherd grazing animals cannot consider them as his property.

lines.gurmukhi: bdrw isir vygwrIAY inrDnu hYrwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Badaraa Siri Vaygaareeai Niradhanu Hairaanu.

Shabad OS B.translation: A bonded labourer carrying a bag full of money on his head,

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir rwKw Kyq ivic nwhI ikrswxw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Raakhaa Khayt Vichi Naahee Kirasaanu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Would still remain poor and wonderstruck.

lines.gurmukhi: pr Gru jwxY Awpxw mUrKu imhmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Par Gharu Jaanai Aapanaa Moorakhu Mihamaanu.

Shabad OS B.translation: As caretaker of the crop is not its owner, similarly the guest who considers other's house as his own is a stupid one.

lines.gurmukhi: Axhodw Awpu gxwiedw Ehu vfw Ajwxw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaaindaa Aohu Vadaa Ajaanu ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the biggest ignorant fool who having nothing of his own pretends to be master of everything.

lines.gurmukhi: kIVI vwk n QMmIAY hsqI dw Bwru
lines.transliteration_english: Keerhee Vaak N Danmeeai Hasatee Daa Bhaaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: An ant cannot bear the weight of an elephant.

lines.gurmukhi: hQ mroVy mKu ikau hovY sIh mwru
lines.transliteration_english: Had Marorhay Makhu Kiu Hovai Seenh Maaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can a fly turning and twisting its limbs be a killer of lions?

lines.gurmukhi: mCru fMgu n pujeI ibsIAru buirAwru
lines.transliteration_english: Machharu Dangu N Pujaee Biseearu Buriaaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mosquito's sting can never equate itself with the poison of a serpent.

lines.gurmukhi: icqRy lK mkauiVAwN ikau hoie iskwru
lines.transliteration_english: Chitray Lakh Makaurhiaan Kiu Hoi Sikaaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can even millions of large black ants hunt a leopard?

lines.gurmukhi: jy jUh sauVI sMjrI rwjw n Bqwru
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Jooh Saurhee Sanjaree Raajaa N Bhataaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: Owner of a quilt infected with millions of lice, cannot be called their King or master.

lines.gurmukhi: AxhoNdw Awpu gxwiedw auhu vfw gvwru ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaaindaa Uhu Vadaa Gavaaru ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who devoid of everything still pretends to have everything is the biggest fool.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 gurU dI prK s`c hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Truth is the test of a Guru

lines.gurmukhi: puqu jxY viV koTVI bwhir jgu jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Poutu Jaanai Varhi Kotdarhee Baahari Jagu Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A son is given birth in a closed room but all the people outside come to know of it.

lines.gurmukhi: Dnu DrqI ivic dbIAY msqku prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhanu Dharatee Vichi Dabeeai Masataki Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wealth even buried in the earth is revealed through facial expressions of the owner.

lines.gurmukhi: vwt vtwaU AwKdy vuTY ieMdRwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Vaat Vataaoo Aakhaday Voutdai Indraanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even an ordinary passerby can tell that it has already rained.

lines.gurmukhi: sBu ko sIsu invwiedw cViHAY cMdRwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhu Ko Seesu Nivaaidaa Charhhiai Chandraanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: All bow towards it as the new moon rises.

lines.gurmukhi: gorK dy gil godVI jgunwQu vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gorakh Day Gali Godarhee Jagu Naadu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gorakh has a patched blanket around his neck but the world knows him as nath, the great master.

lines.gurmukhi: gur prcY guru AwKIAY sic scu is\\\\wxY ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Parachai Guru Aakheeai Sachi Sachu Siaanai ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Knowledge of the Guru is called the Guru; only the truth identifies the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 vIh AOgux

Shabad OS B.translation: I have all the demerits

lines.gurmukhi: hau AprwDI gunhgwru hau bymuK mMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Aparaadhee Gounahagaar Hau Baymoukh Mandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am a criminal, a sinner, evil and apostate.

lines.gurmukhi: coru Xwru jUAwir hau pr Gir johMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Choru Yaaru Jooaari Hau Par Ghari Johandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am a thief, adulterer; gambler who always keeps his eye upon other's household.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdku dustu hrwmKoru Tgu dys TgMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaku Dousatu Haraamakhor Tdagu Days Tdagandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am a slanderer, knave, venal and a swindler who goes on cheating the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kRoDu mdu loB mohu AhMkwr krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Krodh Madu Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I feel proud of my sexual urges, anger, greed, infatuations and other intoxications.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsvwsGwqI AikrqGn mY ko n rKMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Bisavaasaghaatee Akirataghan Mai Ko N Rakhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am treacherous and ungrateful; none likes to keep me with him. Remember,

lines.gurmukhi: ismir murIdw FwFIAw siqguru bKsMdw ]21]36]
lines.transliteration_english: Simari Mureedaa Ddhaaddheeaa Satigur Bakhasandaa ?21?36?chhatee?

Shabad OS B.translation: 0 singing disciple! that the true Guru, alone is competent to grant pardon (for your sins).

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: inrgun srgun kY AlK Aibgq giq pUrn bHm gur rUp pRgtwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Niragoun Saragoun Kai Alakh Abigat Gati , Pooran Braham Gur Roop Pragataaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Supreme Lord whose countenance is beyond perception, who is indestructible, despite being formless took human form and revealed Himself as Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: srgun sRI gur drs kY iDAwn rUp Akul Akwl gurisKnu idKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saragoun Sree Gur Daras Kai Dhiaan Roopa , Akul Akaal Gursikhanu Dikhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: God in His immanent form as Satguru who is beyond all castes, creed and race make the Sikhs realise the true form of God.

lines.gurmukhi: inrgun sRI gur sbd Anhd Duin sbd byDI gur isKnu sunwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Niragoun Sree Gur Sabad Anahad Dhouni , Sabad Baydhee Gur Sikhanu Sounaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The heart piercing melodious tune which Satguru sings to his Sikhs is in fact manifestation of True Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd inhkwm Dwm guruisK mDukr giq lptwey hY ]36]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand Nihakaam Dhaama , Gurousikh Madhoukar Gati Lapataaay Hai ?36?

Shabad OS B.translation: Fragrance of the dust (of the lotus feet of such Satguru) with which the Sikhs remain attached is capable of destroying all worldly desires. (36)
